title.narrative: Enhance food control and surveillance measures through piloting the application of third party certification systems in selected value chains and sectors

description.narrative:
1. The UNIDO’s Food Safety Approach provides the framework for the formulation of food safety capacity building initiatives, including optimization of food control measures through the integration of third party certification systems; 2. Standards and Trade Development Facility (STDF) of the World Trade Organization (WTO) identified UNIDO as a potential partner in the formulation and potential implementation of complementary food safety capacity building intervention related to two regional initiatives by STDF, aiming to integrate third-party certification systems for enhanced national food control systems; 3. UNIDO was invited as member of the Stakeholder Group of the Global Food Safety Conference in February 2019 in Niche. The Stakeholder Group was led by the United Kingdom and Canada with the participation of 29 governmental representatives as well as private sector members of the Global Food Safety Initiative (GFSI). 4. Egypt and Morocco are considered to be included in the technical assistance of UNIDO for the integration of third party assurance (TPA) schemes in the control and surveillance component of their national food control systems (NFCSs). 5. Consultation was held with the relevant UNIDO offices, including Arab Regional Division, UNIDO Representative in Egypt and UNIDO Country Representative in Morocco, on this intervention and potential integration in PCP frameworks. 6. In addition to the financial resources indicated in this PA, remaining funds in the amount of $30,000 was made available from the project Building AIDMO capacity in the context of SDGs (SAP ID: 140261).
The overall objective of the STDF initiative is to contribute to formulation of two regional initiatives in Central America (Honduras and Belize) and Africa (Senegal, Mali and Uganda). In synergy with those initiatives in terms of shared experience, UNIDO develops a regional project for the MENA region related to the integration of third party certification schemes in the national food control systems through piloting capacity building activities in selected agri-food value chains and sectors. Piloting assessment to formulate this initiative will be undertaken in Egypt and Morocco which can be subsequent to changes based on the readiness of the food control authorities.
